subject: Physics
q: Which statement about Newton's third law is correct?
options: For every action there is an equal and opposite reaction.
Action and reaction act on the same body.
Action and reaction do not occur simultaneously.
Action is greater than reaction when bodies are accelerating.
exp: Newton's third law: For every action there is an equal and opposite reaction. They act on different bodies, are simultaneous, and have equal magnitude.

options: Action is greater than reaction when bodies are accelerating.
For every action there is an equal and opposite reaction.
Action and reaction act on the same body.
Action and reaction do not occur simultaneously.
exp: Newton's third law: For every action there is an equal and opposite reaction. They act on different bodies, are simultaneous, and have equal magnitude.
